thread.title: Forex transaction case: CBI raids 50 locations in Delhi
thread.title_full: Forex transaction case: CBI raids 50 locations in Delhi

author: Zainab Mulla | Indo-Asian News Service
title: Forex transaction case: CBI raids 50 locations in Delhi
text:
Forex transaction case: CBI raids 50 locations in Delhi By Indo-Asian News Service on October 11, 2015 at 3:46 PM Comments 
New Delhi, Oct 11: The CBI on Sunday raided 50 locations in Delhi in its ongoing probe in connection with a Bank of Baroda (BoB) branch transferring over Rs.6,172 crore in foreign exchange to Hong Kong, officials said. (Read: Strengthening dollar drains over USD 2 billion from India’s forex reserves) 
It hovered in the range of 64.72 and 65.44 during the week, before concluding at 64.74 per dollar, showing a gain of 77 paise or 1.18 per cent. It has gained 142 paise or 2.15 per cent in the two weeks. The foreign portfolio investors pumped in USD 197.25 million dollars during the first four days of the week, as per the SEBI’s record. 
The Sensex rose 858.56 points or 3.27 per cent to close at 27,079.51. In New York, the US dollar hit multi-week lows against the euro and Swiss franc on Friday, the day after Minutes from the Federal Reserve’s September meeting bolstered expectations for a later interest rate hike, while growth-linked currencies surged. 
  3:46 PM Topics:
